description: Construction of detached two-storey, two bedroomed house with associated cycle storage; refuse/recycling provision and landscaping (following demolition of existing single-storey workshop)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: 767/02, 767/03, 767/04, 767/05 (received 05/04/2012) unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.8, 5.5 and 5.9 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2011). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 and Classes A, B, C, D , E and F of Part 1 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 as amended by the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (Amendment) (No. 2) (England) Order 2008 (or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order), no enlargement, improvement or other alteration of or to the dwellinghouse subject to this permission, including the erection of any outbuilding within the curtilage, shall be carried out without planning permission having first been obtained via the submission of a planning application to the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.8, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2011). | Notwithstanding the drawings submitted with the application, details of obscure glazing shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any work is commenced on the development. Works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and retained permanently.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment (including defensive planting to the ground floor windows) to be erected.  The boundary treatment shall be completed before the building is occupied and development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and shall be permanently retained.  Reason:  To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.8 and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment 2004) and policy 7.4 of the London Plan (2011). | Details of a demolition and construction method statement shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to commencement of works and the approved details shall be implemented during the demolition and construction phases.  Reason:  To protect the living and working conditions of surrounding occupiers and maintain an attractive and safe environment in the locality in accordance with Adopted UDP policies 4.1 and 4.11, and London Plan (2011) policies 7.4 and 7.6. | Prior to the commencement of any works on site, the applicant shall carry out a contaminated land investigation that shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Sampling points and methods of investigation shall be agreed in writing with the Principal Environmental Health Officer prior to the investigation and if deemed necessary by the Local Planning Authority, a scheme shall be submitted for the removal, neutralising and sealing of the contamination, and remedial works implemented before building works commence.  Reason: To ensure that the site is not hazardous, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policy 2.7 and London Plan (2011) policy 5.3. | The approved tree protection measures detailed in Arboricultural Implications Assessment ref: PDS 7064 shall be fully installed prior to any other work commencing on the site, and shall remain in place until completion of all work associated with the construction of the building.  All tree work and protection measures shall be carried out in accordance with the approved method statement.  Reason:  To avoid any adverse effects on the existing trees near the site, in accordance with policies 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policy 7.4 of the London Plan (2011). | The refuse and recycling store shown on the approved drawing ref: 767/02 (received 04/04/12) shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the dwellings and thereafter retained for the life of the development.  Reason: To safeguard the living and working conditions of neighbouring occupiers and in the interest of the environment, in accordance with policy 2.10 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 - Refuse and Recycling Facilities and policies 7.2 and 7.4 of the London Plan (2011).
